ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Learned about present work going on in the MoDLab and FABLab
Qualitative coding

I was able to learn a lot about interjections and was able to see the process of creating a study (brainstorming, reading up on previous studies, discussing with other lab members, etc...)  I took away knowledge about psychology and linguistics and what interesting ways we can continue to study that intersection as well as insights on what research looks like as a career in the future.
I learned a lot about mother-infant interactions in macaques and how to score them in videos, as well as the importance of the use of nonhuman primates in research.
Research methods, data analysis, literature review
So much about how to conduct psych studies and evaluate results, how to communicate about these results and work with a team, & learned so much about myself!

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: A great, supportive space to give and watch practice talks, learning both about the research going on in the lab as well as presentational skills that are important for sharing that research.
I don't think had any particular strengths or weaknesses as it was a pretty flexible course from the start.
I enjoyed working in the lab the past two semesters and look forward to continuing.
This course was great!
Dependent on what lab you work for, but very strong in the ability to get lab experience and guidance.
Amazing!!! Dr Wang is awesome!

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Made the most of the virtual environment with screensharing, etc.
Zoom meetings once a week and online materials to review and prepare beforehand worked well for me.
Remote work was still engaging.
Virtual lab meetings were very fun because we got to meet and speak to people who might not have been able to come otherwise.
I learned so much and grew from virtual lab!

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes! If you have the chance to work in either lab (or any of Yale's other wonderful psych labs), take it! It's a wonderful space for mentorship and learning.
It's really a gamble, depending on the lab, but try to get the most out of it, for sure!
I would highly recommend working in a lab for credit for at least one semester; it's great to gain the experience.
Yes!
Yes, if you want to get credit for your lab work
Yes! If you are able to take a psych lab, do it!

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: Weekly lab meetings + weekly meetings with grad student supervisor
This course was a research for credit course. I worked remotely in a lab at the Yale Child Study Center.
It was both in-person and virtual.
Virtual lab meetings and discussions
